importance: This paper is crucial because it **bridges the gap between embodied AI and emergent communication**, opening exciting new research avenues. It offers a simpler, more efficient approach to using language abstractions in reinforcement learning, which is particularly important for hard exploration problems.  The introduction of the Compactness Ambiguity Metric provides a novel way to evaluate language abstraction quality, aiding future research on emergent communication and its applications in AI.
summary: Empowered AI agents significantly improve exploration in challenging environments by leveraging emergent, rather than natural, language abstractions.
takeaways: Emergent languages provide cost-effective abstractions for reinforcement learning.
The Compactness Ambiguity Metric quantifies how well languages abstract environmental states.
ERELELA, a novel RL agent, demonstrates improved exploration using emergent language.
tldr:
Reinforcement learning (RL) often struggles with exploration, especially in complex environments.  Traditional approaches rely on costly, pre-defined natural language descriptions of states, hindering scalability. This paper explores using emergent languages, which are learned by AI agents themselves through interaction, as a cheaper and more accessible alternative.  This approach addresses the challenge of limited data and allows for more flexible and adaptive state abstractions.
The researchers introduce ERELELA, an RL agent guided by emergent language abstractions.  They demonstrate that ERELELA performs similarly to NL-based agents in procedurally-generated environments.  Furthermore, a novel Compactness Ambiguity Metric is proposed to evaluate the quality of the language-based abstractions, demonstrating that emergent languages create more meaningful abstractions.  This work highlights the potential of unsupervised emergent communication to significantly enhance RL exploration.
